items.title: Three drownings at NSW beaches in 'terrible' start to new year
items.description: Two women and a man have died and two people are missing as a result of four separate incidents in NSW waters in the past 24 hours.

items.title: Planning to travel overseas in 2026? These law changes might affect you
items.description: From currency changes to cleaner toilets, here's what is changing around the world in the new year.

items.title: Banged-up Millennium Falcon the last boat to finish Sydney to Hobart
items.description: A boat named after a Star Wars spacecraft is the final entry to finish the Sydney to Hobart yacht race, after facing a range of issues at sea and extremely rough weather.

items.title: Teen dies after e-bike crashes into pole on New Year's Eve
items.description: A 15-year-old boy has died in an e-bike crash on New Year's Eve, described by Tasmanian police as "tragic" and prompting a call for riders to comply with the law.

items.title: World's first coin of 2026 celebrates 60 years of decimal currency in Australia
items.description: Hundreds of coin collectors forwent the late-night revelry of New Year's Eve in favour of an early morning visit to the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra, hoping to get their hands on the highly sought-after first coin of the year.

items.title: New York City rings in new year with famous ball drop
items.description: Cities around the world have rung in the new year in spectacular style, with fireworks lighting up famous landmarks from the London Eye to Egypt's pyramids.

items.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer sues photographer over fine art prints
items.description: Punk rocker Amy Taylor has filed a lawsuit against an American photographer, alleging that photos taken for a magazine photo shoot are being sold against her wishes and without her permission.

items.title: Australian K-pop idol Danielle dropped from NewJeans and sued by label
items.description: An Australian K-pop idol caught up in a bitter dispute with her former record label is sued for more than $44 million and dropped from her group.

items.title: Australian meat body warns new China beef tariff impact will be 'severe'
items.description: Meat Industry Council says it is "extremely disappointed" as China imposes a tariff on Australian beef imports that could cost $1 billion.

items.title: Case file of last woman hanged in Australia released after 75 years
items.description: Jean Lee and her two co-accused were executed for murder in 1950. Handwritten letters from the trio are among items publicly available for the first time since their trial captured the nation's attention.

items.title: Why Israel's recognition of Somaliland is considered controversial
items.description: Israel, suffering international isolation, has recognised a small territory desperate for international attention. Here's why it has caused an enormous stir.

items.title: Zohran Mamdani sworn in as NYC mayor with midnight subway oath
items.description: Zohran Mamdani is officially sworn in as major of New York City in a midnight, underground ceremony, with a more public affair to take place in hours time on the steps of City Hall.

items.title: Trump says National Guard to be pulled from Chicago, LA and Portland
items.description: US President Donald Trump says his administration is removing the National Guard from Chicago, Los Angeles and Portland, but added federal forces will "come back" if crime rates go up.

items.title: Trump clashes with another Republican congresswoman
items.description: A month after Donald Trump's spectacular falling-out with MAGA firebrand Marjorie Taylor Greene, another Republican congresswoman publicly lashes out at the US president.

items.title: Cabinet papers offer insight into reforms that proved politically fatal for John Howard
items.description: From expectations of a trade union backlash against controversial industrial relations reform, to concerns about "homegrown" extremism in Australia, here are what previously unseen cabinet documents tell us about Australian politics in 2005.

items.title: Scepticism as Russia claims video proves Ukrainian drone attack on Putin residence
items.description: Moscow's allegation that Ukraine launched an attack on the Russian president's state residence is being dismissed as a ploy to derail peace talks.

items.title: Injury-hit trio named in Australia's squad for T20 World Cup
items.description: Pat Cummins, Josh Hazlewood and Tim David are all included in Australia's 15-player squad for next month's men's Twenty20 World Cup in Sri Lanka and India.

items.title: Lorin's father John Clarke had a story to tell, so she recorded their conversations
items.description: When Lorin Clarke asked her father, satirist John Clarke, if she could start recording their conversations, she thought it would just be for them. But when he tragically died aged 68, one year after the recordings began, Lorin felt his story belonged to more than just her.

items.title: Man charged after allegedly filming woman with concealed camera in public toilet
items.description: A southern Tasmanian man aged in his 20s is charged after allegedly using a concealed video recording device to film a woman using a public toilet on New Year's Eve.

items.title: Girl, 12, stabbed and police officers allegedly assaulted in separate Adelaide incidents
items.description: SA Police say 72 people were arrested and 10 were reported for offences overnight as the state rang in the new year.

items.title: 'I need revenge': Sabalenka targets Kyrgios rematch
items.description: Aryna Sabalenka does not want her "Battle of the Sexes" clash with Nick Kyrgios to be the last and insists exhibitions have a vital role to play in tennis.

items.title: 'Catastrophic event': Man who allegedly started New Year's Day fire faces court
items.description: A man has faced court after allegedly sparking an emergency-level bushfire in the Perth Hills that left thousands of people without power and threatened lives and homes.

items.title: Australian soldier fighting for Ukraine 'killed week before wedding'
items.description: Russell Allan Wilson, who spent several years fighting for Ukraine, has been remembered as someone who "gave his life so others could keep theirs".

items.title: Stranded travellers welcome new year in the bush as floods cut roads
items.description: Outback towns remain cut off, and floodwaters are expected to linger in the north-west for weeks. Graziers have started to assess their properties and count stock losses.

items.title: Father and daughter walk 13km for help after escape from flooded car
items.description: Two people from Victoria are rescued after climbing through the window of their car, which was washed away by floodwaters in the Queensland outback.
